title: curl fail on >400 issue
body:
Summary

### Expected Result

Running ```spack mirror create gtkplus``` should create a mirror for some version of ```gtkplus```

### Actual Result

```
==> Adding package gtkplus@2.24.32 to mirror
==> Fetching http://ftp.gnome.org/pub/gnome/sources/gtk+/2.24/gtk+-2.24.32.tar.xz

curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 403 AuthorizedOnly
==> Warning: Error while fetching gtkplus@2.24.32
  Failed to fetch file from URL: http://ftp.gnome.org/pub/gnome/sources/gtk+/2.24/gtk+-2.24.32.tar.xz
==> Successfully updated mirror in spack-mirror-2018-05-31
  Archive stats:
    0    already present
    0    added
    1    failed to fetch.
==> Error: Failed downloads:
gtkplus@2.24.32
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack mirror create gtkplus
```

I understand this issue is not with the gtkplus library or recipe, but it is the only one with which I have had this issue, and so it is more just an example than anything. I am working behind a corporate proxy; I have configured curl with my ```.curlrc``` file to specify the proxy URL and port, and have set ```CURL_CA_BUNDLE``` to point to our cert file. This setup worked for the other 20 or so packages I attempted to mirror.

For whatever reason when trying to fetch from ```http://ftp.gnome.org/pub/gnome/sources/gtk+/2.24/gtk+-2.24.32.tar.xz```, a ```403 AuthorizedOnly``` is kicked back. From https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/lib/spack/spack/fetch_strategy.py#L239, we can see that ```-f``` is supplied to curl to fail on such an error. Oddly enough, removing this flag allowed me to featch the file without any issues.

### Information on your system

curl v7.43.0
